question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Timestamp Monotonicity] current_timestamp from clock on line 65 - if Clock can be manipulated to go backwards, can freshness checks be bypassed? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Max Timestamp Diff Attack] max_timestamp_diff determines freshness window - if set to 0, does this cause all prices to be considered stale? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Updated Time Manipulation] primary_updated_time and secondary_updated_time from oracles - can oracle adaptors return future timestamps to always appear fresh? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Historical Price Staleness] historical_updated_time compared with current_timestamp and historical_price_ttl - if historical data very old, does validation properly reject? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Threshold Configuration] price_diff_threshold1 and price_diff_threshold2 from config - if threshold1 > threshold2, does validation logic handle inverted thresholds? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Threshold Bypass] Lines 100-120 only check thresholds when both prices fresh - can attacker ensure one oracle is always slightly stale to bypass difference checks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Duration Attack] max_duration_within_thresholds on line 102 - if set to very large value, can divergent prices persist indefinitely? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Timer Persistence] diff_threshold2_timer persists across calls - if timer is never reset due to bug, can legitimate price updates be blocked? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Historical Price Initialization] If historical_price is 0 (uninitialized), does validate_price_range_and_history properly handle first price update? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Partial State Update] If line 162 keep_history_update succeeds but line 164 oracle::update_price fails, can inconsistent state persist? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Multiple Feed Updates] If update_single_price called for multiple feeds rapidly, can race conditions cause one feed's state to corrupt another? (Medium)
